title: Pro-p group
summary: In mathematics, a pro-p group (for some prime number p) is a profinite group G {\displaystyle G} such that for any open normal subgroup N â—ƒ G {\displaystyle N\triangleleft G} the quotient group G / N {\displaystyle G/N} is a p-group. Note that, as profinite groups are compact, the open subgroups are exactly the closed subgroups of finite index, so that the discrete quotient group is always finite.
